etymology.description: 對(對) (duì, "to") + 來(來) (lái, "come") + 說(說) (shuō, "speak")
etymology.interpretation: 對(對) (duì, "to") often indicates direction or relation, such as addressing someone or something. 來(來) (lái, "come") and 說(說) (shuō, "speak") together imply bringing forth a statement or opinion. Together, 對來說(對來說) (duì lái shuō) literally means "to come speak," or idiomatically, "as for" or "with regard to." This phrase is used to introduce a perspective or opinion from the standpoint of someone or something.

examples.chinese: 对我来说(對我來說)，学习中文是一件快乐的事(學習中文是一件快樂的事)。
examples.pinyin: Duì wǒ lái shuō, xuéxí Zhōngwén shì yī jiàn kuàilè de shì.
examples.english: As for me, studying Chinese is a joyful matter.

examples.chinese: 对学生来说(對學生來說)，认真学习会带来成功(認真學習會帶來成功)。
examples.pinyin: Duì xuéshēng lái shuō, rènzhēn xuéxí huì dàilái chénggōng.
examples.english: For students, diligent studying will bring success.

examples.chinese: 对艺术家来说(對藝術家來說)，灵感是至关重要的(靈感是至關重要的)。
examples.pinyin: Duì yìshùjiā lái shuō, línggǎn shì zhìguān zhòngyào de.
